label: A3BC9_hP26_194_h_a_hk-001
title: Hexagonal Vaterite (CaCO$_{3}$) Structure
comments:
Numerous structures have been proposed for vaterite: (Downs, 2003) lists fifteen.  (Kabalah-Amitai, 2013) found that vaterite consists of at least two coexisting phases: this disordered hexagonal structure proposed by (Kamhi, 1963), and another \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_a_cd-001}{orthorhombic but pseudo-hexagonal phase}. 
 CaCO$_{3}$ is also found as \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_hR10_167_a_b_e-002}{calcite ($G0_{1}$)}. 
 The carbon and oxygen sites in this structure each have 1/3 occupation, giving the final CaCO$_{3}$ stoichiometry.
